byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson reported from Lafayette, Richard Pérez-Peña from New York, and Alan Blinder from Phenix City, Ala. Leslie Turk contributed reporting from Lafayette. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.
byline.original: By CAMPBELL ROBERTSON, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and ALAN BLINDER

abstract: Law enforcement officials and court documents, along with accounts from acquaintances, portray John Russell Houser, man who opened fire in Lafayette, La, movie theater, as person who had variety of personal, social and political grievances; Houser fatally shot two women and wounded nine people before killing himself; Houser is describe by family as mentally ill and violent.
lead_paragraph: John Russell Houser, the suspect in the theater attack that killed two women in Lafayette, La., was also reported to have vented hatred for liberals and the government.

headline.main: Lafayette Shooting Adds Another Angry Face in the Gunmen’s Gallery
headline.print_headline: Another Angry Face in the Gunmen’s Gallery

snippet: John Russell Houser, the suspect in the theater attack that killed two women in Lafayette, La., was also reported to have vented hatred for liberals and the government.
